intro: Bomarea edulis var. hirtula, commonly known as the hairy bomarea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its tuberous roots and striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as under forest canopies. Its leaves are usually large, heart-shaped, and covered with fine hairs, giving it the "hairy" descriptor in its name. The flowers are often pink or purple and bloom during the warmer months, attracting various pollinators.
